sections.heading: PURPOSE
sections.content: This SOP outlines the procedures for conducting a preparation session between mentors and instructors before an ILT session. The aim is to ensure effective collaboration and comprehensive preparation to enhance the quality of ILT sessions.

sections.heading: SCOPE
sections.content: This SOP applies to all mentors and instructors involved in ILT sessions within Coding Camp 2025.

sections.heading: ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
sections.content:
Mentors: Responsible for initiating communication with instructors and coordinating preparation sessions.
Instructors: Collaborate with mentors, discuss session plans, ensure alignment of objectives and materials, and ensure teaching materials are ready

sections.heading: TIMELINE
sections.content: ILT schedules will be shared with mentors and instructors one week before the scheduled session.

sections.heading: INSTRUCTOR AND MENTOR COORDINATION STEPS
sections.introduction: Follow this SOP to coordinate the ILT preparation and teaching session with your instructor:

steps.subheading: Please Initiate Communication with the Instructors
steps.description: Upon receiving the ILT schedule, please be active to initiate contact with the assigned instructor. Mentors and instructors should agree on a suitable time for the ILT preparation. If the instructor does not respond to your emails within three days (H-3) before the ILT session, please inform the Coding Camp  team via the Discord channel.

We highly recommend conducting preparation sessions with your instructor in a synchronous manner. While asynchronous sessions are possible, it's crucial to ensure that the instructor remains responsive.
details: Discuss session plans, objectives, teaching materials, and resources during the session.
Confirm whether the instructor already has the necessary materials or slides for the ILT session.
If there are activities planned for the ILT session that involve specific tools or platforms, inquire whether the instructor requires any assistance in setting up or conducting these activities.
Ensure that the instructor is well-informed about the teaching schedule and session timings.
Remind the instructors of the importance of starting ILT sessions on time and encourage them to join at least 10 minutes before the scheduled start time.
Both parties should confirm their understanding of the session plan and materials in the ILT preparation session.
